pull.title: Prevent dead-store elimination when clearing secrets in examples

repo.name: secp256k1
repo.description: Optimized C library for EC operations on curve secp256k1

repo.name: secp256k1
repo.description: Optimized C library for EC operations on curve secp256k1

rename.to: Prevent dead-store elimination when clearing secrets in examples

events.body:
Thanks for the PR! 

It's probably a good idea to add this to the examples, but I think an approach that has a separate function like in https://github.com/bitcoin-core/secp256k1/pull/636/commits/494965880b47c3f2b752391b0c757614d6cb9f75 is cleaner. `secure_erase` sounds like a good function name, for example.

> It's probably a good idea to add this to the examples, but I think an approach that has a separate function like in https://github.com/bitcoin-core/secp256k1/commit/494965880b47c3f2b752391b0c757614d6cb9f75 is cleaner. secure_erase sounds like a good function name, for example.

Thanks @real-or-random  for this !! Will look at this soon.

> Please help me a little. I want to get it in phantom wallet. One more thing
I want to know is my address in my phantom wallet where can I get it?

Sorry ?? I guess, This would be a wrong place for the question.

@real-or-random Let me know your feedback on this. Also, I was wondering is there any header where we can club this ? or how about a seperate header for `secure_erase` instead of writing it for each file.

Yes, looks better now. Now if we include such a function, I still feel we should recommend state-of-the art practices, which is what I implemented in https://github.com/bitcoin-core/secp256k1/commit/494965880b47c3f2b752391b0c757614d6cb9f75. Note that essentially the same code was added to Bitcoin Core, see https://github.com/bitcoin-core/secp256k1/commit/494965880b47c3f2b752391b0c757614d6cb9f75. Can you switch to that function body?

> Also, I was wondering is there any header where we can club this ? or how about a seperate header for `secure_erase` instead of writing it for each file.

I think we could put it in `random.h` and rename this to `util.h` or `examples_util.h` to better distinguish it from our own `util.h`.
@real-or-random I tried renaming the file. But, I think that would need to change few other things from `secp256k1.h` which could be part of another patch.

> @real-or-random I tried renaming the file. But, I think that would need to change few other things from `secp256k1.h` which could be part of another patch.

Why do you think so? This should be unrelated?

> > @real-or-random I tried renaming the file. But, I think that would need to change few other things from `secp256k1.h` which could be part of another patch.
> 
> Why do you think so? This should be unrelated?

My bad. I just renamed it and `SECP256K1_INLINE`  instantly throwed an error of `explicit type is missing ('int' assumed)` (And I thought how would renaming a header affect the same file altough I knew we need to change it's name in other files as well)so I assumed we need to fix this from secp.h But on further inspection I got to know that after renaming the header wherever it was used, It can find the inline and things would fix up.
Awesome. Can you also squash the first three commits together?

> Awesome. Can you also squash the first three commits together?

Done !! Thanks for reviewing.

ACK with the comment addressed

That was really the last comment I have.

events.message:
prevent optimization in algorithms

Signed-off-by: Harshil Jani <harshiljani2002@gmail.com>

Add secure_erase function to clear secrets

Signed-off-by: Harshil Jani <harshiljani2002@gmail.com>

Update the function with good practices

Signed-off-by: Harshil Jani <harshiljani2002@gmail.com>

Renaming random.h to examples_util.h

Signed-off-by: Harshil Jani <harshiljani2002@gmail.com>

issue.title: Update Changelog
issue.body:
Looking at the [PRs since the last release](https://github.com/bitcoin-core/secp256k1/pulls?q=is%3Apr+is%3Aclosed+merged%3A%3E%3D2022-12-12+base%3Amaster+sort%3Aupdated-asc), the following ones seem to deserve a changelog entry:

- https://github.com/bitcoin-core/secp256k1/pull/1178
- https://github.com/bitcoin-core/secp256k1/pull/1209
- maybe https://github.com/bitcoin-core/secp256k1/pull/1212

issue.title: Upstream PRs 1160, 1193, 1169, 1190, 1192, 1194, 1196, 1195, 1170, 1172, 1200, 1199, 1203, 1201, 1206, 1078, 1209, 979, 1212, 1218, 1217, 1221, 1222
issue.body:
[bitcoin-core/secp256k1#1160]: Makefile: add `-I$(top_srcdir)/{include,src}` to `CPPFLAGS` for precomputed
[bitcoin-core/secp256k1#1193]: Add `noverify_tests` to `.gitignore`
[bitcoin-core/secp256k1#1169]: Add support for msan instead of valgrind (for memcheck and ctime test)
[bitcoin-core/secp256k1#1190]: Make all non-API functions (except main) static
[bitcoin-core/secp256k1#1192]: Switch to exhaustive groups with small B coefficient
[bitcoin-core/secp256k1#1194]: Ensure safety of ctz_debruijn implementation.
[bitcoin-core/secp256k1#1196]: Drop no longer used variables from the build system
[bitcoin-core/secp256k1#1195]: ctime_tests: improve output when CHECKMEM_RUNNING is not defined
[bitcoin-core/secp256k1#1170]: contexts: Forbid destroying, cloning and randomizing the static context
[bitcoin-core/secp256k1#1172]: benchmarks: fix bench_scalar_split
[bitcoin-core/secp256k1#1200]: Drop no longer used Autoheader macros
[bitcoin-core/secp256k1#1199]: ci: Minor improvements inspired by Bitcoin Core
[bitcoin-core/secp256k1#1203]: Do not link `bench` and `ctime_tests` to `COMMON_LIB`
[bitcoin-core/secp256k1#1201]: ci: Do not set git's `user.{email,name}` config options
[bitcoin-core/secp256k1#1206]: build: Add -Wreserved-identifier supported by clang
[bitcoin-core/secp256k1#1078]: group: Save a normalize_to_zero in gej_add_ge
[bitcoin-core/secp256k1#1209]: build: Add SECP256K1_API_VAR to fix importing variables from DLLs
[bitcoin-core/secp256k1#979]: Native jacobi symbol algorithm
[bitcoin-core/secp256k1#1212]: Prevent dead-store elimination when clearing secrets in examples
[bitcoin-core/secp256k1#1218]: Update overflow check
[bitcoin-core/secp256k1#1217]: Add secp256k1_fe_add_int function
[bitcoin-core/secp256k1#1221]: Update Changelog
[bitcoin-core/secp256k1#1222]: Remove redundant checks.

- made -zkp functions static where possible
- CTIMETEST -> CTIMETESTS
- VG_CHECK_VERIFY(r->n, sizeof(r->n)); -> SECP256K1_CHECKMEM_CHECK_VERIFY

The next PR introduces cmake.

comments.body:
```suggestion
    secure_erase(seckey, sizeof(seckey));
```

And the same for the other calls to `secure_erase`.

> That was really the last comment I have.

Oh that's totally fine. Even I am sceptical about the coding standards for established projects :) 
Done. Thanks for suggesting!!
